results.title: Play-clay
results.creator_credit: Mary Anna Winkler, Peter Erik Winkler and ACI Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “At Your Fingertips”.
Shows how flour, salt and water can be combined to make an inexpensive modelling clay. Explains how to make and decorate various things with it. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mary Anna Winkler, Peter Erik Winkler and ACI Films

results.title: Cylinders (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “At Your Fingertips”.
Designed to help children become aware of the creative possibilities of the cylindrical shape. Using readily available materials found in the home, children create an assortment of play things, models, sculptures and screens.

results.title: Boxes (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Mary Anna Winkler, Peter Erik Winkler and ACI Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “At Your Fingertips”.
Shows a number of things that can be made by children from boxes which originally held house-hold items. Cereal boxes covered with paper and coloured become a model village; milk cartons are made into cars or trains or animals. The biggest cartons, such as those in which refrigerators are delivered, appear as a truck, with two boys as the motive power, delivering to a playhouse. Suitable for lower primary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mary Anna Winkler, Peter Erik Winkler and ACI Films

results.title: Thailand: a land of smiles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”
Presents traditional aspects of the culture of Thailand. Discusses the geography, emphasising the importance of water for travel and agriculture. Shows dances, festivals, handicrafts, and the influence of religion on Thailand’s culture.

group_siblings.title: Silk and strings: a tale of Taiwan

results.title: Silk and strings: a tale of Taiwan
results.creator_credit: Seabourne Enterprises and Bay Street Pictures Inc
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”.
Presents traditional aspects of Taiwanese culture. Contrasts the simple life, costumes, and art and crafts of the original natives of Taiwan with the culture of the Chinese. Focuses on the traditions of China as they are retained in Taiwan, including the cultivation of the arts, music, and calligraphy.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Seabourne Enterprises and Bay Street Pictures Inc

results.title: Thailand - do good receive good, do evil receive evil
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, University of Queensland Press, Film Australia and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the historical and cultural background of Thailand - this film attempts to address racist preconceptions about Thai people and their beliefs and rituals. Concentrates on two elements that affect all Thais: Buddhism and the role of the monarchy. It points out how the Monks appear to be losing their leadership roles as Thai society becomes more urbanised and how the Government is attempting to inform the Monks about social change so they don’t lose their place in society. Includes one or two scenes of violence (burning bodies, slaughter etc.) from newsreels. Presented by John Temple.
results.title_for_label: Thailand - do good receive good, do evil receive evil
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, University of Queensland Press, Film Australia and Australian Broadcasting Commission
